Reckless Remarks of U.S. State Secretary under Fire 
    Pyongyang, March 27 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification issued a statement on March 20 denouncing the reckless remarks of U.S. State Secretary Rice.
 The statement said:
 She did not bother to make absurd remarks terming the north an "outpost of tyranny." She blustered that there is no change in the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK during her visit to south Korea. We can not repress the surging indignation at these outbursts as they are an unbearable insult to the Korean nation.    
 Unless the U.S. rolls back its hostile policy towards the north it would be impossible to achieve the peace in this land, the statement pointed out, warning that Rice, a war servant, should properly behave, clearly understanding the resentment of the Koreans.

DPRK Government's Steps Supported
    Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- We support the measures taken by the DPRK government to defend the sovereignty of the country and are of the view that these measures could avert the U.S. planned war of aggression against the DPRK.
 The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, Austria, said this in a statement issued on March 17 in support of the memorandum of the DPRK Foreign Ministry dated March 2.
 The statement continued: The threat of the Bush administration against the DPRK is increasing day by day.  It is none other than the U.S. that wantonly breaches international law.    
 The statement strongly demanded the U.S. administration roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK without delay, come out to the negotiating table without any preconditions and withdraw its troops and nuclear weapons from south Korea. Only when it does so, is it possible to realize the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, it added.

articles.title: Korean People's Efforts for National Reunification Supported
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Military Exercises Denounced
    Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association issued a statement on March 18 to denounce the United States and south Korea for their large-scale war exercises.
 The statement said that the war exercises can, in no case, go together with dialogue for the peaceful settlement of the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula. They would be a grave provocative act of spoiling the atmosphere of dialogue and threatening peace, it added.    
 This reality clearly proves that the United States is, in fact, not interested even a bit in seeking a negotiated solution to the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula, the statement noted, urging the U.S. to stop the military exercises in south Korea if it truly wants detente, peace and dialogue on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.content:
Korean People's Efforts for National Reunification Supported
    Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, expressed invariable support and solidarity for the Workers' Party and people of Korea
in their struggle to achieve national reunification from foreign interference when meeting So Jae Myong, DPRK ambassador to Mexico, who paid a courtesy call on him on March 18.
 He said his party rejoices as over its own over the successes made by the Korean people in socialist construction upholding the banner of the Juche idea under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

Meeting of Korea-China Hydro-Power Company
    Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- A decision of the 56th meeting of the Board of Directors of Korea-China Hydro-Electric Power Company was signed in Pyongyang on Mar. 25.
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were the members of the DPRK delegation headed by Director of the Board Sin Yong Song, vice-minister of Electricity and Coal Industries, and from the Chinese side were the members of the Chinese delegation led by acting Director of the Board Liu Chen, managing director of the North-East Power Grid Co., Ltd. of China, and Gu Jinsheng, economic and commercial counselor of the Chinese embassy here.

Visits
    Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean General Federation of Science and Technology headed by Choe Sang Gon, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, left here Saturday to visit China.
 An art troupe of the International United Confederation of Koreans arrived here today to participate in the 23rd April Spring Friendship Art Festival.

Resolucion de sesion del consejo de una empresa Corea-China
     Pyongyang, 26 de marzo (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricada el dia 25 en esta capital una resolucion de la 56a sesion del Consejo de la Compania de Generacion Hidroelectrica Corea-China.
  En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes los miembros de la delegacion coreana presidida por Sin Yong Song, viceministro de la Industria de Electricidad y Carbon y director en jefe de la parte coreana del Consejo de dicha empresa, los integrantes de la delegacion china encabezada por Liu Chen, director general de la Compania Ltd. de la Red de Electricidad del Nordeste de China y director interino de la parte china del citado Consejo, y Gu Jinsheng, consejero economico y comercial de la Embajada de la Republica Popular China en Corea.
